They predicted positive value in Q2. It clearly shows they have strong believe in reducing the cost.

https://seekingalpha.com/news/3588166-nioplus-6-on-rise-in-q2-deliveries

They already beat their Q2 delivery guidance from Q1 call. That's why the stock moved up significantly. We need to continue to see growth in Q3 and Q4 delivery in order to support your bullish claims.

It does not matter if it's a growth or a value company, EPS is all it matters at the end. Negative EPS means the company is NOT profitable, and gross margin improvement is an important step, but need to see EPS growth as well. NIO is literally stacking up liabilities to fund growth, and it can end horribly (CHK) if NIO is not profitable in next few years. How to pay debt if you don't generate positive cash flow, take on more new debt to pay the maturing debt, you know it's not going well. The problem is that they have negative debt to equity ratio, which is a big concern imo.

The price action is literally fueled with TSLA, and the Q2 beats on delivery really push it over the top. Usually a price movement like this will warrant some analyst upgrade or PT increase, but none of this happen, and GS rated if sell.

Definitely profit taking on July 13, and if you look at the chart, it's begging you to sell, and volume drops off means no reversal is coming. I said it earlier that it's time to sell, and you insist the long term value of this stocks.

Strongly recommend you read earnings call transcript and financial statement before being so bullish on a stock. It seems like you are just buying into speculation.
